intro: Ixora synactica, commonly known as the golden flame or sweet-scented ixora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bright orange to yellow flowers. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement and often have a glossy texture. Ixora synactica is evergreen and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, making it a popular ornamental plant. Its fragrant flowers bloom throughout the year, adding vibrant color to gardens and landscapes.
